import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Define target and features
target = 'SalePrice'
features = [col for col in train_df.columns if col != target]

# Handle missing values and encode categorical variables
# Fill numerical missing values with median
numerical_cols = train_df.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
numerical_cols = [col for col in numerical_cols if col != target]

# Fill categorical missing values with mode
categorical_cols = train_df.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
categorical_cols = [col for col in categorical_cols if col != target]

# Fill missing values in numerical columns
train_df[numerical_cols] = train_df[numerical_cols].fillna(train_df[numerical_cols].median())
test_df[numerical_cols] = test_df[numerical_cols].fillna(test_df[numerical_cols].median())

# Fill missing values in categorical columns
for col in categorical_cols:
    train_df[col] = train_df[col].fillna(train_df[col].mode()[0])
    test_df[col] = test_df[col].fillna(test_df[col].mode()[0])

# One-hot encode categorical features
categorical_features = [col for col in categorical_cols if col not in ['Id']]
categorical_features = [col for col in categorical_features if col in train_df.columns]

# Create preprocessing pipeline
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', 'passthrough', numerical_cols),
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore'), categorical_features)
    ],
    remainder='passthrough'

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target and features
target = 'SalePrice'
features = [col for col in train_df.columns if col != target]

# Handle missing values
numerical_cols = train_df.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
numerical_cols = [col for col in numerical_cols if col != target]

categorical_cols = train_df.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
categorical_cols = [col for col in categorical_cols if col != target]

# Fill missing values
train_df[numerical_cols] = train_df[numerical_cols].fillna(train_df[numerical_cols].median())
test_df[numerical_cols] = test_df[numerical_cols].fillna(test_df[numerical_cols].median())

for col in categorical_cols:
    train_df[col] = train_df[col].fillna(train_df[col].mode()[0])
    test_df[col] = test_df[col].fillna(test_df[col].mode()[0])

# One-hot encode categorical features
categorical_features = [col for col in categorical_cols if col not in ['Id']]
categorical_features = [col for col in categorical_features if col in train_df.columns]

# Create preprocessing pipeline
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', 'passthrough', numerical_cols),
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore'), categorical_features)
    ],
    remainder='passthrough'
)

# Prepare data
X_train = train_df[features]
y_train = train_df[target]
X_test = test_df[features]

# Train model
model = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42))
])

model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_test_pred = model.predic

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target and features
target = 'SalePrice'
features = [col for col in train_df.columns if col != target]

# Handle missing values
numerical_cols = train_df.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
numerical_cols = [col for col in numerical_cols if col != target]

categorical_cols = train_df.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
categorical_cols = [col for col in categorical_cols if col != target]

# Fill missing values
train_df[numerical_cols] = train_df[numerical_cols].fillna(train_df[numerical_cols].median())
test_df[numerical_cols] = test_df[numerical_cols].fillna(test_df[numerical_cols].median())

for col in categorical_cols:
    train_df[col] = train_df[col].fillna(train_df[col].mode()[0])
    test_df[col] = test_df[col].fillna(test_df[col].mode()[0])

# One-hot encode categorical features
categorical_features = [col for col in categorical_cols if col not in ['Id']]
categorical_features = [col for col in categorical_features if col in train_df.columns]

# Create preprocessing pipeline
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', 'passthrough', numerical_cols),
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore'), categorical_features)
    ],
    remainder='passthrough'
)

# Prepare data
X_train = train_df[features]
y_train = train_df[target]
X_test = test_df[features]

# Train model
model = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42))
])

model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test)

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target and features
target = 'SalePrice'
features = [col for col in train_df.columns if col != target]

# Handle missing values
numerical_cols = train_df.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
numerical_cols = [col for col in numerical_cols if col != target]

categorical_cols = train_df.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
categorical_cols = [col for col in categorical_cols if col != target]

# Fill missing values

test_df[numerical_cols] = test_df[numerical_cols].fillna(test_df[numerical_cols].median())

for col in categorical_cols:
    train_df[col] = train_df[col].fillna(train_df[col].mode()[0])
    test_df[col] = test_df[col].fillna(test_df[col].mode()[0])

# One-hot encode categorical features
categorical_features = [col for col in categorical_cols if col not in ['Id']]
categorical_features = [col for col in categorical_features if col in train_df.columns]

# Create preprocessing pipeline
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', 'passthrough', numerical_cols),
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(drop='first', handle_unknown='ignore'), categorical_features)
    ],
    remainder='passthrough'
)

# Prepare data
X_train = train_df[features]
y_train = train_df[target]
X_test = test_df[features]

# Train model
model = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42))
])

model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
